A fair coin will be tossed three times. The set of possible outcomes may be described by the ordered triples {<math alttext="H H H" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>HHH</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>, <math alttext="H H T" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>HHT</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>, <math alttext="H T H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HTH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="H T T" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HTT</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="T H H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>THH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="T H T" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>THT</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="T T H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>TTH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="T T T" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>TTT</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>}, where <math alttext="H" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>H</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> represents heads and <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>T</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> represents tails.

What is the probability that all three tosses result in heads, given that the three tosses result in more heads than tails?
